tool.name: hicPlotMatrix
tool.command:
ln -s $matrix input_matrix.npz &&
hicPlotMatrix #if $matrix and $matrix is not None: --matrix input_matrix.npz #end if
#if $title and $title is not None: --title $title #end if
#if $scoreName and $scoreName is not None: --scoreName $scoreName #end if
#if $outFileName and $outFileName is not None: --outFileName plot.png #end if
$perChromosome $clearMaskedBins
--whatToShow $whatToShow.whatToShow_select
## special: --chromosomeOrder is optional, but if given needs at least one argument #set chroms = '" "'.join([ str($var.chromosome) for $var in $chromosomeOrder ]) #if chroms --chromosomeOrder "$chroms" #end if
#if $region and $region is not None: --region $region #end if
#if $region2 and $region2 is not None: --region2 $region2 #end if $log1p $log
#if $colorMap and $colorMap is not None: --colorMap $colorMap #end if
#if $vMin and $vMin is not None: --vMin $vMin #end if
#if $vMax and $vMax is not None: --vMax $vMax #end if
#if $whatToShow.whatToShow_select != 'heatmap': --zMax $zMax #end if

param.name: perChromosome
param.label: Plot per chromosome
param.help: Instead of plotting the whole matrix each chromosome is plotted next to the other. This parameter is not compatible with --region

param.name: clearMaskedBins
param.label: Remove masked bins from the matrix

repeat.name: chromosomeOrder
repeat.title: Chromosomes to include (and order to plot in):

param.name: region
param.label: Plot only this region.
param.help: The format is chr:start-end The plotted region contains the main diagonal and is symmetric unless --region2 is given

param.name: region2
param.label: If given then only the region defined by --region and --region2 is given. The format is the same as --region1

param.name: log1p
param.label: Plot the log1p of the matrix values.

param.name: log
param.label: Plot the *MINUS* log of the matrix values.

tool.help:
**What it does**
Plots a HiC matrix heatmap.
